newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan receives bids for palm olein tender.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan receives bids for palm olein tender.

text.p: The state-run Trading Corporation of Pakistan (TCP) received five bids C & F on Tuesday in response to its tender for 2,000 to 4,000 tonnes of RBD palm olein for shipment by December 20, traders said.
They said all five bids were for 4,000 tonnes.
A trader, who asked not to be named, said Qulei Edible Oil of Malaysia was the lowest bidder at $577.93 per tonne C & F.
He said Cargil had offered $578.25, Felda $579, Ngo Chew Hong $579.69 and Pan Century $578.40 a tonne.

An official of the TCP, which issued the tender on behalf of the state-run Ghee Corporation of Pakistan (GCP), had earlier said the TCP would only be interested in rates quoted below $557 per tonne FOB.
The trader said the C & F rates quoted were very competitive, given that FOB rates quoted in Kuala Lumpur were around $515.
The TCP scrapped tenders for 2,000 tonnes of RBD palm olein last Thursday after receiving bids at $571 per tonne and $568.70 per tonne -- prices it considered too high, traders said.
The TCP bought 4,500 tonnes of RBD palmoil the same day at a C & F rate of $529.40 per tonne from Pan Century for shipment by December 10.
